data.text: @RavenOT7BTS I think from what I read, the governor of Nevada just change the requirements in the beginning of February. Their announcement does say they’re going to make it safe. Maybe HYBE will make a release on what they want now.
@LilMeowMeowBTS7 Didn’t they release requirements on weverse when they made the announcement about the Vegas tours?
@7purplebird @TiberiusTrue https://t.co/vtKMtKmYkU. If you scroll in the middle of their announcement go to Covid and this is where I got it from. There’s nothing else so far.

@LilMeowMeowBTS7 @TiberiusTrue I am vaccinated, boosted, and have lots of masks. 😃
just need a concert ticket. LOL.

@7purplebird @TiberiusTrue That is at the same stadium & the event organizers for that is requesting for everybody to wear a mask. Other than that, allegiant stadium is saying that they are not requiring masks. It’s up to the event organizer. BTS hasn’t released anything yet.

@TiberiusTrue @LilMeowMeowBTS7 I agree with you. But I clicked to see and it said "Thank you for purchasing a ticket to the 57th Academy of Country Music Awards."  and it wants people to put their vaccine info there. But this is a different event at the same stadium?

@LilMeowMeowBTS7 Why don’t they use a secure https, why just http? Curious. People entered their registering medical information on just http, seems risky. I think we ought to look into this. Either the stadium is negligent or something is wrong. Just a thought.
